description: POSITION: Growth Marketing Data Analyst JOB DUTIES: Collaborate with the user acquisition team to identify impactful business problems, translate them into structured analysis, and effectively communicate the results. Develop quantitative analysis, ad hoc reports, and statistical models to support marketing decisions related to marketing spend efficiency, user lifetime value, user engagement & retention, and return on investment. Develop frameworks for forecasting, exploring trends, and spotting anomalies. Conduct deep dives & analytical investigations into inconsistent trends in data. Design experiments to test the validity of hypotheses around user acquisition strategy. Create tables, dashboards and graphs to showcase marketing campaign metrics. Remote work permitted within the U.S. HOURS: 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday SALARY: Zone 1: $165,500.14 - $195,600 Zone 2: $165,500.14 - $176,000 Zone 3: $165,500.14 LOCATION: Mercari, Inc., 3101 Park Blvd, Palo Alto, CA 94306 REQUIREMENTS Main Requirement: Bachelor of Science degree in Analytics, Finance, Statistics, Data Science, Economics or closely related field of study and five (5) years of experience as a Manager, Analyst, or related role where required experience gained. Alternate Requirement: Employer will accept a Master of Science degree in Analytics, Finance, Statistics, Data Science, Economics or closely related field of study and two (2) years of experience in stated fields. Special Skills: Also requires 2 years of experience in the following: - SQL, R, or other querying languages; - Visualization tools such as Tableau/Looker; - Digital or performance marketing; - Designing and analyzing A/B experiments; - Calculating LTV, ROI, and Cost per action; and - Developing incrementality tests using geographic targeting. CONTACT: Email resume to us_jobs@mercari.com. Please reference job title and location. Zone 1 includes locales such as the San Francisco Bay Area and New York City Zone 2 includes locales such as Austin, Boston, Los Angeles and Seattle Zone 3 includes locales such as Denver, St. Louis, and Houston #LI-DNI
